overview: This subject examines the brain systems, research tools and insights from the brain and psychological sciences relevant to marketing theory and practice. Topics include neuroscience fundamentals; neuroscience technology used in marketing research; functional implications of key brain systems for marketing planning; applications of neuroscientific and psychological tools and insights for marketing research and ethical considerations associated with use of brain imaging technology for marketing research.
ilo: Describe and understand the benefits/limitations of tools and techniques used in neuromarketing research,
Identify and discuss the function of selected brain regions and systems in marketing neuroscience research,
Explain functional implications of selected perceptual, cognitive and emotional processes for marketing theory,
Critically evaluate and apply neuromarketing research insights in selected marketing practices.

content.Name: Principles of Marketing
content.Teaching period: Semester 1 (On Campus - Parkville)Summer Term (On Campus - Parkville)Semester 2 (On Campus - Parkville)
